page.description: Generates a QR Code from a character value.
page.syntax: qrcode as P = printQRCode (value as C [, sizeInPixels as N [, flagURLEncodeValue as L ]])

argument.name: value
argument.description: The value to encode in the QR Code image.

description.p: The size of the QR Code, in pixels.
Defines whether or not the value should be url encoded.

discussion.p: To print a QR Code in a report, define a calculated field using the printQRCode() function. The calculated field can then be placed in the report.
The printQRCode() function takes three arguments - the value to encode, the size of the QR code (in pixels) and a flag that indicates if the value should be url encoded (set to .t. by default).

section.note: The QR Code function calls into the Google charts api, so an Internet connection is required.
